docs.lead_paragraph: GRASSE, France. LANDING in Europe after a year and a half spent in different regions of the United States, I received the immediate impression of a universal and startling shabbiness. Shabbiness of things-wharves, docks, railway stations, hotels, shops and public buildings. I do not regret that edifices should be small and old, but that they should be crying aloud for a coat of paint and an air of brightness is painful.

headline.main: OLD WORLD, NEW WORLD:; WHERE IS THE BETTER LIFE?

docs.abstract: Life in Amer and on Continent compared by O Keun; illus
